alert.note: Alert for Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:58PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Kay County through 445 PM CDT... At 358 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southeast of Ponca City, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Newkirk, Kaw City, Kildare, and Kaw Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
